flags.title: User-Contributed Project
flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

guide.introduction: This easy-to-make kitchen utensil takes only a short amount of time to build. Only a small number of tools are required and parts can be found virtually anywhere.
guide.introduction_rendered:
This easy-to-make kitchen utensil takes only a short amount of time to build. Only a small number of tools are required and parts can be found virtually anywhere.

Relevant parts
  • Thin wire
  • tennis balls
  • tennis racquet
  • Glue
Tools
  • Hacksaw
  • hand-held electric drill
  • small drill bit

lines.text: Take three tennis balls and drill holes 1" apart in a straight line. These will be used to attach the balls to the racquet.
lines.text_raw: Take three tennis balls and drill holes 1" apart in a straight line. These will be used to attach the balls to the racquet.

lines.text: String a piece of wire 2" long through the racquet and into the holes. Apply super glue to create an extra-strong bond.
lines.text_raw: String a piece of wire 2" long through the racquet and into the holes. Apply super glue to create an extra-strong bond.

lines.text: You started with three tennis balls and an old racquet.
lines.text_raw: You started with three tennis balls and an old racquet.

lines.text: Now you have a cool kitchen utensil!
lines.text_raw: Now you have a cool kitchen utensil!

lines.text: You could also cut tennis balls in half and use them to hold candles on top of the racquet.
lines.text_raw: You could also cut tennis balls in half and use them to hold candles on top of the racquet.

guide.summary: Make a cookie tray for tennis enthusiasts.
guide.title: Tennis Racquet Cookie Tray
